method.name: client_id
method.description: Optional. The Discord application ID for your game. Defaults to the value set by <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1ad452335c06b28be0406dab824acccc49" kindref="member">Client::SetApplicationId</ref>.

method.name: code_challenge
method.description: If using the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1aaee636f91fb1ea3465157c20313b702c" kindref="member">Client::GetToken</ref> flow, you will need to generate a code challenge and verifier. Use <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1aba6adc1f978e7bf4c5433c560e1ad704" kindref="member">Client::CreateAuthorizationCodeVerifier</ref> to generate these values and pass the challenge property here.

method.name: custom_scheme_param
method.description: Custom URI scheme for mobile redirects. This allows games to specify a completely custom URI scheme for OAuth redirects. For example, setting this to "mygame" will result in a URI scheme like: mygame:/authorize/callback If not provided, defaults to the standard Discord format: discord-123456789:/authorize/callback This is particularly useful for distinguishing between multiple games from the same developer or for avoiding conflicts with other apps.

method.name: integration_type
method.description: The type of integration the app will be installed as. [url=https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/application#installation-context]https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/application#installation-context[/url]

method.name: nonce
method.description: The nonce field is generally only useful for backend integrations using ID tokens. For more information, see: [url=https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#rfc.section.2~nonce:~:text=auth_time%20response%20parameter]https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#rfc.section.2~nonce:~:text=auth_time%20response%20parameter[/url].)-,nonce,-String%20value%20used

method.name: scopes
method.description: Scopes is a space separated string of the oauth scopes your game is requesting. Most games should just pass in <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a71499da752fbdc2d4326ae0fd36c0dd1" kindref="member">Client::GetDefaultCommunicationScopes</ref> or <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a7648bd1d2f7d9a86ebd0edb8bef12b5c" kindref="member">Client::GetDefaultPresenceScopes</ref> which will include these scopes, respectively: [code]openid sdk.social_layer[/code] or [code]openid sdk.social_layer_presence[/code] [code]sdk.social_layer[/code] and [code]sdk.social_layer_presence[/code] automatically expand to include all the necessary scopes for the integration. You can pass in additional scopes if you need to, but as a general rule you should only request the scopes you actually need, and the user will need to grant access to those additional scopes as well.

method.name: state
method.description: See [url=https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/oauth2#state-and-security]https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/oauth2#state-and-security[/url] for details on this field. We recommend leaving this unset, and the SDK will automatically generate a secure random value for you.
